title: Remote vs Office Impact Calculator
description: Calculate the true financial and time value of working remotely compared to an office-based role.

inputs.name: commuteCost
inputs.label: Total Annual Commute Cost (if in office)

inputs.name: rentDifference
inputs.label: Monthly Rent Savings (if remote allows cheaper area)

methodSummary: Calculates savings on commute, food, and rent when working remotely.
Valuates saved commute time at a baseline rate to show 'lifestyle' value.
Remote Equivalent Raise = Total Annual Gain / Base Salary.
assumptions: Calculates value based on 48 work weeks per year.
Time saved is valued at a conservative baseline rate of $25/hr.
insights: A fully remote role can be equivalent to a 15-20% raise when commute and food costs are high.
The time saved from a 1-hour round-trip commute equals roughly 240 hours per yearâ€”equivalent to 6 extra weeks of life.

faqs.a: It's a conservative baseline to represent that your time has value. You can mentally adjust if your personal time-value is higher.
Estimate what you spend on lunches and coffee at the office vs. eating at home. Often this is $10-$20 per day.
Increased electricity or heating costs are usually minimal compared to commute savings, but you can subtract them from 'Total Savings' mentally.

faqs.q: Does this tool work for hybrid roles?
faqs.a: Yes. Simply adjust the 'Remote Days per Week' to match your schedule (e.g., 3 remote, 2 office).
If being remote allows you to move to a lower cost-of-living area, enter your monthly rent saving to see its massive impact.
Technically no, unless you use it for side-work, but 'lifestyle value' is a critical metric for long-term career happiness.
